contents.title: The Coral Project Notes
contents.description_html: When I'm managing communities, particularly ones around controversial news like my former work at The Huffington Post or current work with Salon.com, I'm eager to hear from commenters motivated by a deep interest in the subject matter. These readers feel a personal ownership to the work they are reading, draw in others, and move them to action.
contents.description: When I'm managing communities, particularly ones around controversial news like my former work at The Huffington Post or current work with Salon.com, I'm eager to hear from commenters motivated by a deep interest in the subject matter. These readers feel a personal ownership to the work they are reading, draw in others, and move them to action.

contents.title: Gardens Need Walls: On Boundaries, Ritual, and Beauty
contents.generated_title: Gardens Need Walls: On Boundaries, Ritual, and Beauty
contents.description_html: This essay attempts to place ritual in the context of evolving complex systems, and to offer an explanation for why everything is so ugly and nobody seems to be able to do anything about it.
contents.description: This essay attempts to place ritual in the context of evolving complex systems, and to offer an explanation for why everything is so ugly and nobody seems to be able to do anything about it.

source.title: Gardens Need Walls: On Boundaries, Ritual, and Beauty

contents.title: Conference Code of Conduct
contents.description_html: All attendees, speakers, sponsors and volunteers at our conference are required to agree with the following code of conduct. contents.title: Our Code of Conduct And Why It's Important For Diversity And Inclusion - Open
contents.generated_title: Our Code of Conduct And Why It's Important For Diversity And Inclusion - Open
contents.description_html: We aspire to live by our values at Buffer. We also strive daily to turn our values into behaviors that positively impact how we treat each other, how we interact with others, and how we see the world. Even still, we feel that having values isn't enough.
contents.description: We aspire to live by our values at Buffer. We also strive daily to turn our values into behaviors that positively impact how we treat each other, how we interact with others, and how we see the world. Even still, we feel that having values isn't enough.

contents.title: Vox Product Code of Conduct
contents.description_html: This code of conduct governs the environment of the Vox Product team. We created it not because we anticipate bad behavior, but because we believe that articulating our values and obligations to one another reinforces the already exceptional level of respect among the team and because having a code provides us with clear avenues to correct our culture should it ever stray from that course.
contents.description: This code of conduct governs the environment of the Vox Product team. We created it not because we anticipate bad behavior, but because we believe that articulating our values and obligations to one another reinforces the already exceptional level of respect among the team and because having a code provides us with clear avenues to correct our culture should it ever stray from that course.

contents.title: Citizen Code of Conduct
contents.description_html: A primary goal of COMMUNITY_NAME is to be inclusive to the largest number of contributors, with the most varied and diverse backgrounds possible. As such, we are committed to providing a friendly, safe and welcoming environment for all, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, ability, ethnicity, socioeconomic status, and religion (or lack thereof).
contents.description: A primary goal of COMMUNITY_NAME is to be inclusive to the largest number of contributors, with the most varied and diverse backgrounds possible. As such, we are committed to providing a friendly, safe and welcoming environment for all, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, ability, ethnicity, socioeconomic status, and religion (or lack thereof).

contents.title: Django Code of Conduct | Django
contents.description_html: This code of conduct applies to all spaces managed by the Django project or Django Software Foundation. This includes IRC, the mailing lists, the issue tracker, DSF events, and any other forums created by the project team which the community uses for communication.
contents.description: This code of conduct applies to all spaces managed by the Django project or Django Software Foundation. This includes IRC, the mailing lists, the issue tracker, DSF events, and any other forums created by the project team which the community uses for communication.

contents.title: anti-harassment statement
contents.description_html: In light of recent public conversations spurred by incidents at other conferences, and in the spirit of being both proactive and inclusive, it is important that we communicate the Organizing Committee's commitment to providing a harassment-free space for participants of all races, gender and trans statuses, sexual orientations, physical abilities, physical appearances, body sizes, and beliefs.
contents.description: In light of recent public conversations spurred by incidents at other conferences, and in the spirit of being both proactive and inclusive, it is important that we communicate the Organizing Committee's commitment to providing a harassment-free space for participants of all races, gender and trans statuses, sexual orientations, physical abilities, physical appearances, body sizes, and beliefs.

contents.title: Conference anti-harassment/Policy
contents.description_html: Contents[show] Introduction This is an example anti-harassment policy suitable for most open source, computing, or technology-related conferences. It may be adopted unchanged or tweaked to suit your conference. Why have an official anti-harassment policy for your conference? First, it is necessary (unfortunately).
contents.description: Contents[show] Introduction This is an example anti-harassment policy suitable for most open source, computing, or technology-related conferences.
